TITLE: LinkedIn is having a moment thanks to a wave of layoffs
SUMMARY: In a normal year at this time, a typical LinkedIn feed might be full of posts about year-end reflections on leadership and professional goals and suggested lifehacks for the year ahead — possibly with a few posts from CMOs offering tips on brand strategy, for good measure.

TITLE: From color-changing cars to self-driving strollers, here's some of the coolest tech from CES 2023
SUMMARY: A long list of companies once again showed off an assortment of cutting edge technology and oddball gadgets at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas last week.

TITLE: Deere gives farmers long-sought ability to repair their own tractors
SUMMARY: US farmers will have the right to repair tractors and other agricultural equipment from John Deere without having to use the manufacturer's own parts and facilities, under an agreement the company signed Sunday with farm industry representatives.

TITLE: Silicon Valley layoffs go from bad to worse
SUMMARY: Shortly before Thanksgiving, Amazon CEO Andy Jassy confirmed rumors that layoffs had begun in multiple departments at the e-commerce giant and said it would review staffing needs into the new year.

TITLE: Seattle public schools sue social media companies for allegedly harming students' mental health
SUMMARY: Seattle's public school system on Friday filed a lawsuit against several Big Tech companies alleging their platforms have a negative impact on students' mental health and claiming that has impeded the ability of its schools "to fulfill its educational mission."

TITLE: Former Twitter employees get severance offer after months of waiting. Many are unhappy with it
SUMMARY: After months of uncertainty and feeling left in the dark, many former Twitter employees impacted by a mass layoff in early November began receiving their severance offers over the weekend. But some are frustrated by the offer and the conditions attached to it.

TITLE: Chinese rocket startup Galactic Energy sends five satellites into space
SUMMARY: Galactic Energy, a rocket startup in China, launched five satellites into orbit on Monday, boosting the private company's ambition to become the Chinese rival to SpaceX.

TITLE: Musk's Twitter restores accounts of prominent election deniers two years after Jan. 6 attack
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's Twitter has restored the accounts of two prominent election deniers who were banned from the platform following the January 6, 2021 attack on the US Capitol.

TITLE: The US government is still trying to find ways to regulate Big Tech. He has some ideas
SUMMARY: After years of hearings, reports and stalled proposals, Congress ended 2022 without taking major steps to regulate Big Tech. But a few blocks away in Washington, Jonathan Kanter is just getting warmed up.

TITLE: What is NOTAM, the FAA computer system that halted all US flights?
SUMMARY: A critical Federal Aviation Administration computer system that experienced an outage Wednesday and briefly halted all US flights provides airlines with a digital bulletin board of crucial safety updates.

TITLE: Why experts worry TikTok could add to mental health crisis among US teens
SUMMARY: Jermone Yankey said he used to pull all-nighters when he was in college -- not studying or partying, but scrolling on TikTok until the sun came up.

TITLE: Biden urges Congress to pass bipartisan tech legislation in WSJ op-ed
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden called on members of Congress Wednesday to set aside partisan differences and pass groundbreaking legislation to rein in Big Tech, focusing on digital privacy, antitrust and the industry's liability shield, Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act.

TITLE: Apple's first US labor union reaches new milestone for tech industry
SUMMARY: Workers at Apple's first unionized retail store began collectively bargaining with management on Wednesday, in a milestone moment not only for the iPhone company but for all of Big Tech.

TITLE: Elon Musk's Twitter accused of unlawful staff firings in the UK
SUMMARY: A law firm representing dozens of former UK Twitter employees is accusing the company of "unlawful, unfair and completely unacceptable treatment" of workers following recent mass layoffs.

TITLE: Inside Facebook's high-stakes debate to reinstate Trump after a two-year ban
SUMMARY: Facebook-parent Meta is preparing to announce one of the most consequential decisions in the company's history, a landmark move that will set a precedent for online speech and could affect the course of the 2024 US presidential election.

TITLE: Why Apple may finally be embracing touchscreen laptops
SUMMARY: Over the years, Apple has added touchscreens to almost every computing device imaginable, from phones and tablets to smartwatches, but it has refrained from bringing the feature to its Mac product line -- even as a long list of rivals did so with their laptops and desktops.

TITLE: FAA is years away from upgrading the system that grounded all US flights
SUMMARY: The Federal Aviation Administration software that failed Wednesday causing thousands of flight delays and cancellations is 30 years old and at least six years away from being updated, a government source familiar with the situation tells CNN.

TITLE: Google claims a Supreme Court defeat would transform the internet — for the worse
SUMMARY: An unfavorable ruling against Google in a closely watched Supreme Court case this term about YouTube's recommendation engine could have sweeping unintended consequences for much of the wider internet, the search giant argued in a legal filing Thursday.

TITLE: World's top chip maker mulls global expansion with plants in Europe, Japan
SUMMARY: Semiconductor giant Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) may expand its global manufacturing footprint even further.

TITLE: Sweden finds the largest rare earth deposit in Europe. It could help cut dependence on China
SUMMARY: Swedish mining company LKAB says it has found Europe's largest deposit of rare earth oxides in the country's north, a discovery that could reduce the continent's reliance on China for the critical resource.

TITLE: Tim Cook agrees to a massive pay cut
SUMMARY: Apple CEO Tim Cook has agreed to cut his pay this year after shareholders rebelled.

Millions have been using the new AI technology ChatGPT for everything from songwriting to this CNN commentary. "It's good for people trying to generate huge amounts of text that doesn't have to be especially convincing very quickly," says Bloomberg Businessweek Columnist Max Chafkin, but also "it makes stuff up."

TITLE: China allows Didi to resume signing up new users as tech crackdown eases
SUMMARY: Ride-hailing giant Didi received approval to resume new user registration in China, it said Monday, providing more evidence that Beijing's regulatory crackdown on tech giants might be coming to an end.

TITLE: Fed up with facial recognition cameras monitoring your every move? Italian fashion may have the answer
SUMMARY: The red-headed man wearing what looks like the ultimate Christmas sweater walks up to the camera. A yellow quadrant surrounds him. Facial recognition software immediately identifies the man as ... a giraffe?

TITLE: More than half of US states have cracked down on TikTok access from government devices
SUMMARY: More than half of all US states have partially or fully banned TikTok from government devices, according to a CNN analysis, reflecting a wave of recent clampdowns by governors and state agencies targeting the short-form video app.

TITLE: Apparently This Matters: Fart-filter undies
SUMMARY: CNN humor columnist Jarrett Bellini looks at Shreddies, a new fart-filtering underwear.

TITLE: Zombies and snails: African gaming apps
SUMMARY: Africa's smartphone market is driving new gaming apps, featuring everything from Zombie killers to cheeky snails.

TITLE: Xbox One launch starts new console war
SUMMARY: The XBox One from Microsoft hit stores a week after rival Sony's PlayStation 4 release.

TITLE: Speaking out against cell service on planes
SUMMARY: Commercial air travel is already filled with annoyances like shrinking personal space, overpriced meals and frequent delays. Will phone calls be next?

TITLE: New high tech wheel could be revolutionary
SUMMARY: Attempting to reinvent the wheel is the ultimate in design folly. But this didn't stop object designer Duncan Fitzsimmons from giving it a go.

SUMMARY: Sprint tumbled to last place in this year's Consumer Reports rankings for wireless service providers, which are based on a survey of users.

SUMMARY: Researchers are using ultra high-speed cameras to study hummingbird flight, so they can build better flying robots.

SUMMARY: Wireless carriers are pushing back against a kill switch feature, which would allow smartphone owners to disable their stolen devices remotely.

SUMMARY: A meteorite from Mars, found in the Sahara Desert, has preserved materials from its home planet that are 4.4 billion years old.

SUMMARY: Even as it celebrates brisk sales of its new PlayStation 4, Sony is offering help to gamers experiencing problems with the next-generation gaming console.

TITLE: Intel CEO: Chip supply chains will shape geopolitics more than oil over the next 50 years
SUMMARY: Global politics will be dominated by the availability, trade and investment in microchips for the next several decades, Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger told CNN Tuesday.

TITLE: Getty Images suing the makers of popular AI art tool for allegedly stealing photos
SUMMARY: Getty Images announced a lawsuit against Stability AI, the company behind popular AI art tool Stable Diffusion, alleging the tech company committed copyright infringement.

TITLE: Tesla video promoting self-driving was staged, engineer testifies
SUMMARY: A 2016 video that Tesla (TSLA) used to promote its self-driving technology was staged to show capabilities like stopping at a red light and accelerating at a green light that the system did not have, according to testimony by a senior engineer.

TITLE: Microsoft set to announce big layoffs, media report
SUMMARY: Microsoft could announce thousands of job cuts on Wednesday, according to multiple news reports, potentially becoming the latest tech company to cull its workforce as the global economy slows.

TITLE: Microsoft set to announce big layoffs, according to multiple reports
SUMMARY: Microsoft could announce thousands of job cuts on Wednesday, according to multiple news reports, potentially becoming the latest tech company to cull its workforce as the global economy slows.

TITLE: Microsoft is laying off 10,000 employees
SUMMARY: Microsoft plans to lay off 10,000 employees as part of broader cost-cutting measures, the company said in a securities filing on Wednesday, making it the latest tech company to rethink staffing amid economic uncertainty.

TITLE: Davos conspiracy theories used to live on fringe corners of the internet. Now they've gone mainstream
SUMMARY: The World Economic Forum's annual meeting at Davos has long been a lightning rod for conspiracy theories. Extremist figures such as Infowars host Alex Jones have reliably used the event to drive up fear and paranoia about sinister schemes the "globalists" are supposedly plotting.

TITLE: University of Texas at Austin blocks TikTok from its IT network
SUMMARY: The University of Texas at Austin blocked TikTok from its IT network on Wednesday under an earlier order by Gov. Greg Abbott banning the short-form video app from state-managed electronic resources.

TITLE: Trump campaign has asked Meta to unblock the former president's Facebook account
SUMMARY: Former President Trump's campaign sent a letter to Facebook's parent company, Meta, Tuesday petitioning them to unblock his Facebook account, a source familiar with the letter tells CNN.

TITLE: FEC dismisses RNC complaint that Google's spam filters were biased against conservatives
SUMMARY: The Federal Election Commission has tossed out claims by the Republican National Committee that Google's spam filters in Gmail are illegally biased against conservatives, according to an agency letter obtained by CNN.

TITLE: US Labor Department accuses Amazon of failing to keep warehouse workers safe
SUMMARY: Amazon has been accused by federal safety regulators of failing to keep warehouse workers safe from workplace hazards at three US facilities, in the latest example of government officials scrutinizing the e-commerce giant's labor practices.

TITLE: China to launch state-backed transport platform for ride-hailing, trucking
SUMMARY: China will soon launch a state-backed platform for transport which includes services of ride-hailing, cargo trucking, road transport, railway, ferry and flight services, Chinese state media Beijing Daily reported on Wednesday.

TITLE: Amazon axes its charity donation program
SUMMARY: Amazon is shutting down its "Smile" charity donation program as the company cuts costs and rethinks its strategy.

TITLE: Teachers are adapting to concerns about a powerful new AI tool
SUMMARY: When Kristen Asplin heard about a powerful new AI chatbot tool called ChatGPT going viral online recently with its ability to write frighteningly good essays in seconds, she worried about how her students could use it to cheat.

TITLE: Instagram rolls out 'quiet mode' for when users want to focus
SUMMARY: Instagram on Thursday announced a new feature called "quiet mode," which aims to help users focus and set boundaries with friends and followers.

TITLE: CEOs at Davos are using ChatGPT to write work emails
SUMMARY: Jeff Maggioncalda, the CEO of online learning provider Coursera, said that when he first tried ChatGPT, he was "dumbstruck." Now, it's part of his daily routine.

TITLE: Cloudflare says White House asked tech firm to bypass Iran censorship, but US sanctions got in the way
SUMMARY: A senior White House official asked US tech company Cloudflare to help circumvent internet censorship in Iran after protests erupted in that country last September but US sanctions prevented the firm from doing so, Cloudflare CEO Mathew Prince said Thursday at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

TITLE: 37 million T-Mobile customers were hacked
SUMMARY: T-Mobile said a "bad actor" accessed personal data from 37 million current customers in a November data breach.

TITLE: Google-parent Alphabet is cutting 12,000 jobs
SUMMARY: Google parent Alphabet is eliminating about 12,000 jobs, or 6% of its workforce, the company said Friday, in the latest cuts to shake the technology sector.

TITLE: Meta, Twitter, Microsoft and others urge Supreme Court not to allow lawsuits against tech algorithms
SUMMARY: A wide range of businesses, internet users, academics and even human rights experts defended Big Tech's liability shield Thursday in a pivotal Supreme Court case about YouTube algorithms, with some arguing that excluding AI-driven recommendation engines from federal legal protections would cause sweeping changes to the open internet.

TITLE: ChatGPT isn't coming. It's here
SUMMARY: Jeff Maggioncalda, the CEO of online learning provider Coursera, said that when he first tried ChatGPT, he was "dumbstruck." Now, it's part of his daily routine.

TITLE: Who is Shou Zi Chew? Mounting scrutiny on TikTok could put new spotlight on its CEO
SUMMARY: When TikTok was the title sponsor last summer for Vidcon, an annual convention for the creators and brands that make up a key part of the short-form video app's audience and business, it was Chief Operating Officer Vanessa Pappas who got on stage for the industry keynote event.

TITLE: After a historic first mission, what does the future hold for this controversial rocket?
SUMMARY: Boeing has been mired in controveries, including delays and myriad issues with a spacecraft it built for one NASA program and scandals plaguing its airplane division. But it is one of the key contractors that built NASA's new moon rocket.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes made an 'attempt to flee the country' after her conviction, prosecutors say
SUMMARY: Elizabeth Holmes made an "attempt to flee the country" by booking a one-way ticket to Mexico in January 2022, shortly after the Theranos founder was convicted of fraud, prosecutors alleged in a new court filing Friday.

TITLE: FTC calls on federal court to hold 'pharma bro' Martin Shkreli in contempt
SUMMARY: The Federal Trade Commission on Friday called for a federal court to hold "Pharma Bro" Martin Shkreli in contempt after Shkreli allegedly flouted a recent FTC investigation into his business dealings and failed to make a $64.6 million payment he owed for his prior wrongdoings.

TITLE: How Big Tech's pandemic bubble burst
SUMMARY: In January 2021, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella spoke in lofty terms about how the first year of the pandemic had sparked a staggering shift toward online services, benefiting his company in the process. "What we have witnessed over the past year is the dawn of a second wave of digital transformation sweeping every company and every industry," he said.

TITLE: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani is addicted to ChatGPT
SUMMARY: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani says he is addicted to ChatGPT, the powerful new AI tool that interacts with users in an eerily convincing and conversational way.

TITLE: Spotify to cut 6% of its workforce
SUMMARY: Spotify said Monday that it will cut 6% of its global workforce to reduce costs, joining tech companies including Amazon and Microsoft in slashing headcount as the global economy slows.

TITLE: Microsoft confirms it's investing billions in ChatGPT creator OpenAI
SUMMARY: Microsoft on Monday confirmed it is making a "multibillion dollar" investment in OpenAI,  the company behind the viral new chatbot tool called ChatGPT.

TITLE: Microsoft confirms it's investing billions in the creator of ChatGPT
SUMMARY: Microsoft on Monday confirmed it is making a "multibillion dollar" investment in OpenAI,  the company behind the viral new AI chatbot tool called ChatGPT.

TITLE: UK's Crown Estate sues Twitter over alleged non-payment of rent in London offices
SUMMARY: The Crown Estate, a British commercial property portfolio historically belonging to the monarch, began court proceedings against Twitter over the tech giant's alleged non-payment of rent in its London offices, a spokesperson of the property business told CNN on Monday.

TITLE: 'I cried all night': Millions of Chinese lose access to 'World of Warcraft' and other hit games
SUMMARY: Millions of players in China have lost access to the iconic "World of Warcraft" franchise and other popular video games, as Blizzard Entertainment's servers in the country went offline after two decades.

TITLE: DOJ sues Google over its dominance in online advertising market
SUMMARY: The Justice Department and eight states sued Google on Tuesday, accusing the company of harming competition with its dominance in the online advertising market and calling for it to be broken up.

TITLE: Ticketmaster under fire: 6 takeaways from hearing over Taylor Swift concert fiasco
SUMMARY: A top executive at Ticketmaster's parent company Live Nation Entertainment was grilled by lawmakers on Tuesday after the service's inability to process orders for Taylor Swift's upcoming tour left millions of people unable to buy tickets late last year.

TITLE: Microsoft quarterly profit falls 12% but cloud computing business shows strength
SUMMARY: Microsoft on Tuesday posted weaker-than-expected revenue and a double-digit percentage drop in profit for the final three months of last year amid broader economic uncertainty and reduced demand for personal computers and software.

TITLE: Ticketmaster gets grilled: 6 takeaways from hearing over Taylor Swift concert fiasco
SUMMARY: Lawmakers grilled a top executive of Ticketmaster's parent company, Live Nation Entertainment, on Tuesday after the service's inability to process orders for Taylor Swift's upcoming tour left millions of people unable to buy tickets late last year.

SUMMARY: Microsoft on Wednesday said it had recovered all of its cloud services after a networking outage took down its cloud platform Azure along with services such as Teams and Outlook used by millions around the globe.

SUMMARY: Is ChatGPT the new Clippy?

TITLE: Classic 'GoldenEye 007' game is coming to Nintendo Switch and Xbox

TITLE: Meta says it will restore Donald Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts
SUMMARY: Facebook-parent Meta said on Wednesday that it will restore former President Donald Trump's accounts on Facebook and Instagram in the coming weeks, just over two years after suspending him in the wake of the January 6 Capitol attack.

TITLE: One news publication had an AI tool write articles. It didn't go well
SUMMARY: News outlet CNET said Wednesday it has issued corrections on a number of articles, including some that it described as "substantial," after using an artificial intelligence-powered tool to help write dozens of stories.

TITLE: IBM is cutting 3,900 jobs
SUMMARY: IBM has become the latest tech giant to slash thousands of jobs, with 3,900 positions, or 1.5% of its global workforce, expected to be eliminated.

TITLE: IBM and SAP are cutting thousands of jobs
SUMMARY: IBM and SAP are the latest tech companies to slash thousands of jobs, as they reorganize businesses and profits come under pressure from a slowing global economy.

SUMMARY: For the better part of 15 years, Google has seemed like an unstoppable force, powered by the strength of its online search engine and digital advertising business. But both now look increasingly vulnerable.

SUMMARY: News outlet CNET said Wednesday it has issued corrections on a number of articles, including some that it described as "substantial," after using an artificial intelligence-powered tool to help write dozens of stories.

TITLE: ChatGPT passes exams from law and business schools
SUMMARY: ChatGPT is smart enough to pass prestigious graduate-level exams -- though not with particularly high marks.

TITLE: Madison Square Garden CEO doubles down on use of facial recognition tech
SUMMARY: The chief executive of the Madison Square Garden Entertainment Corporation has doubled down on using facial recognition at its venues to bar lawyers suing the group from attending events.

TITLE: Meta and Twitter decided to restore Trump's account. Will other platforms follow suit?
SUMMARY: Former president Donald Trump could soon make a return to Facebook, Instagram and Twitter, and reach the massive audiences on each, now that the companies behind those platforms have restored access to his accounts.

SUMMARY: "There might be someone getting shot tomorrow."

TITLE: China still wants to control Big Tech. It's just pulling different strings
SUMMARY: Investors have raced back into Chinese tech stocks this year, encouraged by an apparent truce in a two-year battle between some of the country's most powerful regulators and its biggest internet companies.

TITLE: Real estate agents say they can't imagine working without ChatGPT now
SUMMARY: If you came across a four bedroom, 3.5 bathroom home listed for sale recently on a quiet cul-de-sac in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, you might not think twice about the online listing. It included typical real estate descriptions like "ideal for entertaining" and "ample space for relaxation."
Researchers took gallium, a metal with a low melting point, and embedded it with magnetic particles to create a robot that can melt and move. Their inspiration? A sea cucumber.

TITLE: ASML says 'rules are being finalized' on chip export controls to China
SUMMARY: ASML, a Dutch maker of semiconductor equipment, says "rules are being finalized" on export controls, amid reports that the Netherlands and Japan have joined the United States in restricting sales of some computer chip machinery to China.

TITLE: TikTok CEO to testify before Congress in March
SUMMARY: TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew will testify at an upcoming hearing before the House Energy and Commerce Committee, a committee spokesperson confirmed to CNN Monday.

TITLE: Samsung profits sink to 8-year low as smartphone and PC demand drops
SUMMARY: Samsung's quarterly profits have plunged to their lowest level in eight years as customers snapped up fewer cell phones and laptops.

TITLE: China says it is 'deeply concerned' about reports of the latest US clampdown on Huawei
SUMMARY: China has hit back after reports that Washington is moving to further restrict sales of American technology to Huawei.

TITLE: This app lets Silicon Valley workers commiserate about layoffs in secret
SUMMARY: In the week before Microsoft publicly announced plans to cut 10,000 jobs, thousands of workers at the tech giant who were eager for any information about the looming layoffs joined a professional networking site — not LinkedIn, which Microsoft owns, but Blind.

TITLE: Apple has infringed on worker rights, NLRB investigators say
SUMMARY: Apple has illegally imposed rules on its employees that prohibit them from discussing their wages and engaging in other protected activity, according to investigators at the National Labor Relations Board.

TITLE: As mass layoffs spread, tech workers are flocking to this app
SUMMARY: In the week before Microsoft publicly announced plans to cut 10,000 jobs, thousands of workers at the tech giant who were eager for any information about the looming layoffs joined a professional networking site — not LinkedIn, which Microsoft owns, but Blind.

TITLE: ChatGPT creator rolls out 'imperfect' tool to help teachers spot potential cheating
SUMMARY: Two months after OpenAI unnerved some educators with the public release of ChatGPT, an AI chatbot that can help students and professionals generate shockingly convincing essays, the company is unveiling a new tool to help teachers adapt.

TITLE: Instagram's founders are back with a new app
SUMMARY: More than four years after Instagram's founders left the company, they're back with a new app.

TITLE: Snap stock plunges 15% as revenue growth stalls
SUMMARY: Snapchat's parent company reported stalled revenue growth and a large net loss for the final three months of 2022, as it confronts tighter advertiser budgets amid broader economic uncertainty.

TITLE: Tech CEO apologizes for quoting Martin Luther King Jr. in layoff announcement
SUMMARY: A tech CEO is apologizing after quoting Martin Luther King Jr. in a layoffs announcement.

TITLE: Apple is the only US tech giant to have avoided significant layoffs. Will it last?
SUMMARY: In less than three months, four of the big five US tech companies have cut tens of thousands of employees combined, shattering myths about the industry's seemingly unstoppable growth in the process.

TITLE: Apple and Google's app stores wield 'gatekeeper' power and should be reined in, Commerce Department says
SUMMARY: The Biden administration on Wednesday took its biggest swipe yet at app stores run by Apple and Google, with a new report accusing the two tech giants of exercising "gatekeeper" power that has led to "suboptimal" levels of competition in digital markets.

TITLE: EV maker Rivian to cut 6% of jobs amid price war
SUMMARY: Rivian Automotive is laying off 6% of its workforce in an effort to cut costs as the EV maker, already grappling with falling cash reserves and a weak economy, braces for an industry-wide price war.

TITLE: Samsung unveils Galaxy S23 lineup with powerhouse camera
SUMMARY: At its annual Unpacked event on Wednesday, Samsung is set to unveil its latest Galaxy S smartphones -- and the company is betting that focusing on improvements to the camera will be enough to get consumers to upgrade.

TITLE: Record $3.8 billion stolen in crypto hacks last year, report says
SUMMARY: A record $3.8 billion worth of cryptocurrency was stolen from various services last year, with much of those thefts driven by North Korean-linked hackers, according to a report Wednesday from blockchain analytics firm Chainalysis.

TITLE: ChatGPT creator launches subscription service for viral AI chatbot
SUMMARY: OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT, announced on Wednesday it is piloting a $20 monthly subscription plan that offers users priority access to the AI chatbot even during peak times.

TITLE: Judge reportedly allows Meta to move forward with VR startup acquisition, in blow to FTC
SUMMARY: A federal judge will not block Meta from buying a virtual reality tech startup, according to multiple reports, in a setback for the US government, which had alleged the deal would threaten competition in a nascent market.

TITLE: Meta shares surge nearly 20% as Zuckerberg pledges to make 2023 a 'year of efficiency'
SUMMARY: For years, Facebook and its CEO Mark Zuckerberg invested heavily in growth, including in areas like virtual reality with unproven potential. But after a brutal year in which the company lost more than $600 billion in market value, Zuckerberg has started speaking Wall Street's language — and they are rewarding him for it.

TITLE: 'Nigerian iTunes' dances to the mobile beat
SUMMARY: A new music startup is providing an easy away for Nigerian music fans to access their favorite songs.

TITLE: 18-propeller electric helicopter takes flight
SUMMARY: An electric helicopter -- powered by 18 propellers -- has made its maiden flight. Could it be the future of urban transport?

TITLE: Mutant fungus croaks frog named after Darwin
SUMMARY: A mutant fungus is killing amphibians everywhere, threatening with extinction a frog species named for Darwin.

TITLE: Famous comet may be in trouble
SUMMARY: ISON, the most closely watched comet in recent years, may be falling apart as it nears its close encounter with the sun.

TITLE: How facial recognition could help fight crime
SUMMARY: From fighting terrorism to processing payments in the blink of an eye, facial recognition is set to change our ideas on privacy.

TITLE: New photos celebrate 'Earth from Space'
SUMMARY: A new book, "Earth from Space," contains 150 satellite photos emphasizing the beauty, fragility of our planet.

TITLE: Feeding the world without killing the planet
SUMMARY: With 7.1 billion mouths to feed, and plenty more on the way, the world needs to find new ways to feed its citizens.

TITLE: These designs will help you survive disaster
SUMMARY: Access to clean water, shelter, warmth and sanitation is a matter of life of death in the days and weeks after an earthquake, tsunami, flood or tornado.

SUMMARY: Apple has bought PrimeSense, an Israeli 3-D-sensor company that helped build Microsoft's motion-control system Kinect.

TITLE: A first generation iPhone going up for auction hopes to fetch $50,000
SUMMARY: An unopened first-generation iPhone from 2007 is hitting the auction block Thursday -- with an estimated value of $50,000.

TITLE: Activision Blizzard settles SEC charges for $35 million
SUMMARY: Activision Blizzard will pay $35 million to settle US government allegations that the video game giant violated a whistleblower protection rule and lacked processes to collect workplace misconduct complaints, according to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

TITLE: Why Twitter users are upset about the platform's latest change
SUMMARY: Users are once again worried about Twitter's future and overall culture following the platform's announcement that it will no longer provide free access to its API. Here's what API is and how this change could affect Twitter.

TITLE: Foxconn January sales hit record high after production restored at world's biggest iPhone factory
SUMMARY: Apple supplier Foxconn says its January monthly sales hit a record high as it bounced back from Covid-19 disruptions in China.

TITLE: Dell to lay off 5% of its workforce
SUMMARY: Dell plans to lay off roughly 5% of its workforce, the company said in a regulatory filing Monday, in the latest example of tech companies cutting costs in an uncertain economic climate.

TITLE: Dell to lay off more than 6,500 employees
SUMMARY: Dell plans to lay off roughly 5% of its workforce, the company said in a regulatory filing Monday, in the latest example of tech companies cutting costs in an uncertain economic climate.

TITLE: Google unveils its ChatGPT rival
SUMMARY: Google-parent Alphabet on Monday unveiled a new chatbot tool dubbed "Bard" in an apparent bid to compete with the viral success of ChatGPT.

TITLE: Chinese search engine giant Baidu announces ChatGPT-style AI bot
SUMMARY: Chinese search engine giant Baidu says it will be launching its own ChatGPT-style service.

TITLE: Baidu stock surges after announcement of ChatGPT-style AI bot
SUMMARY: Shares in Baidu soared on Tuesday, after the Chinese search engine giant said it would be launching its own ChatGPT-style service.

TITLE: Microsoft Outlook email experiences outage
SUMMARY: Microsoft Outlook experienced an outage late Monday night and into Tuesday morning.

TITLE: Massive Microsoft Outlook outage brings email to a halt
SUMMARY: Microsoft reported a "gradual recovery" in its Outlook service early Tuesday after a widespread outage for several hours overnight halted email and disrupted Teams and other products.

TITLE: US senators seek answers from Meta on whether user data was accessed by China, Russia and others
SUMMARY: Top US lawmakers on the Senate Intelligence Committee want answers from Meta on a newly disclosed internal investigation it conducted in 2018 that found tens of thousands of software developers in China, Russia and other "high-risk" countries may have had access to detailed Facebook user data before the company clamped down on that access beginning in 2014.

TITLE: Microsoft set to hold mystery event as ChatGPT competition heats up
SUMMARY: Microsoft on Tuesday is set to hold a mystery event at its Redmond, Washington headquarters, weeks after it confirmed plans to invest billions in OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT.

TITLE: Sen. Daines's Twitter account suspended after posting profile picture of himself hunting
SUMMARY: Twitter has suspended Montana Republican Sen. Steve Daines's account for violations of the company's sensitive media policy.

TITLE: Microsoft unveils revamped Bing search engine using AI technology more powerful than ChatGPT
SUMMARY: Microsoft on Tuesday announced a revamp of its Bing search engine and Edge web browser powered by artificial intelligence, weeks after it confirmed plans to invest billions in OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT.

TITLE: Zoom will lay off 1,300 employees and CEO is taking a massive pay cut
SUMMARY: Zoom on Tuesday said it will lay off about 1,300 employees, or approximately 15% of its staff, becoming the latest tech company to announce significant job cuts as a pandemic-fueled surge in demand for digital services wanes.

TITLE: Sen. Daines' Twitter account suspended after posting profile picture of himself hunting
SUMMARY: Twitter temporarily suspended Montana Republican Sen. Steve Daines's account for violations of the company's sensitive media policy.

TITLE: Google details plans to use AI in search results
SUMMARY: Google on Wednesday detailed plans to use artificial intelligence technology to radically change how people search for information online, one day after rival Microsoft announced a revamped version of Bing powered by AI.

TITLE: Uber reports 'strongest quarter ever' while the rest of Silicon Valley stalls
SUMMARY: Uber on Wednesday reported strong revenue growth in the final three months of last year, defying a slowdown that has pummeled much of the rest of the tech sector.

TITLE: UK competition regulator warns Microsoft's Activision deal could harm millions of gamers
SUMMARY: Microsoft's $69 billion purchase of Activision Blizzard could harm competition by letting Microsoft restrict Activision's video games to proprietary platforms such as Xbox, UK officials said Wednesday, in the latest challenge to the tech giant's blockbuster acquisition.

TITLE: I tried Microsoft's new AI-powered Bing. Here's what it's like
SUMMARY: Microsoft's Bing search engine has never made much of a dent in Google's dominance in the more than 13 years since it launched. Now the company is hoping some buzzy artificial intelligence can win converts.

TITLE: Twitter restricted in Turkey, according to network monitoring firm
SUMMARY: Access to Twitter has been restricted in Turkey, according to reports by an internet monitoring company as well as journalists and academics tracking the country's response to the devastating earthquake this week.

TITLE: Google's AI chatbot Bard called out for inaccurate response in public demo
SUMMARY: Google's much-hyped new AI chatbot tool Bard, which has yet to be released to the public, is already being called out for an inaccurate response it produced in a demo this week.

TITLE: Google's AI chatbot Bard had an inaccurate response in public demo
SUMMARY: Google's much-hyped new AI chatbot tool Bard, which has yet to be released to the public, is already being called out for an inaccurate response it produced in a demo this week.

TITLE: Twitter users briefly unable to tweet, send messages
SUMMARY: Twitter users on Wednesday briefly encountered various issues with the platform, including the inability to tweet, send direct messages or follow new accounts.

TITLE: Twitter access in Turkey is restored, according to network monitoring firm
SUMMARY: Access to Twitter has been restored in Turkey, according to internet monitoring company Netblocks.

TITLE: Alibaba is launching a ChatGPT rival too
SUMMARY: Alibaba confirmed Thursday it was launching its own ChatGPT-style tool, becoming the latest tech giant to get behind the hype for the viral chatbot application.

TITLE: The way we search for information online is about to change
SUMMARY: An entire generation of internet users has approached search engines the same way for decades: enter a few words into a search box and wait for a page of relevant results to emerge. But that could change soon.

TITLE: Hogwarts Legacy breaks record before official release, despite controversy
SUMMARY: The world of Harry Potter is getting new life.

TITLE: Google shares lose $100 billion after company's AI chatbot makes an error during demo
SUMMARY: Google's much-hyped new AI chatbot tool Bard, which has yet to be released to the public, is already being called out for an inaccurate response it produced in a demo this week.

TITLE: Meta restores Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts
SUMMARY: Donald Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts were restored on Thursday, allowing the former president to once again post on the social media platforms, a Meta spokesperson confirmed to CNN.

TITLE: Elon Musk pledged transparency at Twitter. But he's walling off researchers
SUMMARY: For years, Twitter, like other social media platforms, has freely given its platform data to independent researchers so that they can analyze everything from online trolling to the spread of misinformation. Those studies have been critical to understanding the tactics used by scammers, foreign influence campaigns and other malicious actors trying to manipulate social media.

TITLE: Yahoo to lay off 20% of its workforce
SUMMARY: Yahoo said Thursday that it will cut 20% of its total workforce by the end of this year as it restructures its advertising unit, just the latest example of the layoffs spreading throughout the tech and media industries.

TITLE: Lyft shares fall nearly 25% after forecasting revenue below estimates
SUMMARY: Lyft on Thursday forecast current-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates, blaming extremely cold weather in some of its major markets and lower prices, especially during peak hours, sending its shares down nearly 25% in extended trading.

SpaceX completed what it says was a successful test after 31 of the 33 Raptor engines on its Starship rocket fired during a statis test. Starship is what SpaceX hopes to use to one day send humans to Mars.

TITLE: SEC targets 'crypto-staking' in $30 million Kraken settlement
SUMMARY: The Securities and Exchange Commission has reached a $30 million settlement with the cryptocurrency platform Kraken that will force it to unwind a program offering investment returns to US users who committed their digital assets to the company.

TITLE: SEC reaches $30 million settlement with Kraken
SUMMARY: The Securities and Exchange Commission has reached a $30 million settlement with the cryptocurrency platform Kraken that will force it to unwind a program offering investment returns to US users who committed their digital assets to the company.

TITLE: More than half of Twitter's top 1,000 advertisers stopped spending on platform, data show
SUMMARY: More than half of Twitter's top 1,000 advertisers in September were no longer spending on the platform in the first weeks of January, according to data provided to CNN by digital marketing analysis firm Pathmatics, in a striking sign of how far reaching the advertiser exodus has been following Elon Musk's acquisition of the company.

TITLE: Congressman who raised issue of antisemitism on Twitter says he was bombarded with antisemitic tweets
SUMMARY: A Jewish lawmaker who spoke about the problem of antisemitism on Twitter during a House Oversight hearing this week focused on the company was later bombarded with antisemitic messages on the platform, he explained in a letter to new owner Elon Musk on Thursday.

TITLE: Is the iPhone's 'Made in India' era about to begin?
SUMMARY: As Apple looks beyond China to secure crucial supply chains strained by Covid lockdowns and threatened by rising geopolitical tension, India has emerged as an attractive potential alternative to the world's second largest economy.

SUMMARY: Let's be honest: For much of the past decade, tech events have been pretty boring.

SUMMARY: A proposal to ban TikTok in the United States "should be looked at," according to US Senator Chuck Schumer.

SUMMARY: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba has sold its remaining stake in Paytm, India's top digital payment app, as it gradually divests from its Indian investments amid friction between Beijing and New Delhi.

SUMMARY: Google is working hard to make you love Google+, its growing but still often-overlooked social network.
